On a study conducted by Dan Ariely on his book Predictably Irrational, he mentions that people can use a "decoy" either in business or romance. In this case, it'd work by you going out with a friend that looks like you, but is noticeably less attractive, thus making you look better in comparison. In business for example, you'd have a competitor's product or a similar product (but worse quality) priced the same as the one you'd want them to buy, again to make it look better in comparison.

One doesn't need a wingman per se. Meaning that there's no need for your friend to actually do anything, but to be there. If you're alone and then tag on to some girl it immediately seems a bit more clingy, but if a woman has already seen you chatting someone else and having good time, she feels more comfortable talking to you as well.

And it's not too hard to find company even when you're alone, but it does narrow your possibilities quite a bit and feels much more awkward to go chat a girl up when she and possibly others too have already seen you alone in some dark corner. Then it takes a bit more social skills to open up a conversation without immediately getting shut out.
